text: Calixtus II (or Calistus II) (died 13 December 1124), born Guy de Burgundy, the fourth son of William I, Count of Burgundy, was elected Pope on 1 February 1119 after the death of Pope Gelasius II.John W. O'Malley, A History of the Popes: From Peter to the Present, (Rowman & Littlefield Publishers, 2010), 116. His pontificate was shaped by the Investiture Controversy, which he was able to settle through the Concordat of Worms (in 1122). ==Sources== Category:1060s births Category:1124 deaths Category:French popes
title: Pope Callixtus II
